Na2 sites, and the third broad peak (529 nm) can be

vious analysis results depending on different symmetries.
Furthermore, the decay behaviors of Eu
are generally different depending on the variable chemical
environment. To further verify the existence of three Eu

Thermal stability acts as a vital parameter for LED
phosphors in practical applications since the LED chip
normally reaches temperatures up to ~150 °C at high
power. The thermal quenching behavior can be elucidated
using the conﬁgurational coordinate diagram. Based on
this model, the excited luminescent center is thermally
1–15%). The inset shows the dependence of
normalized integrated emission intensities and FWHM values on the Eu
at room temperature. The inset shows a digital photograph of the cyan NKLSO:8%Eu
phosphor under a 365 nm UV lamp.
